text: The functions of basic helix-loop-helix ( bHLH ) transcription factors in activating differentiation - linked gene expression and in inducing G1 cell cycle arrest are negatively regulated by members of the Id family of HLH proteins .

These bHLH antagonists are induced during a mitogenic signalling response , and they function by sequestering their bHLH targets in inactive heterodimers that are unable to bind to specific gene regulatory ( E box ) sequences .

Recently , <extra_id_0> cyclin E <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> Cdk2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> cyclin A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> Cdk2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent phosphorylation of a single conserved serine residue ( Ser5 ) in <extra_id_0> Id2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been shown to occur during late G1-to - S phase transition of the cell cycle , and this neutralizes the function of <extra_id_0> Id2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in abrogating E-box - dependent bHLH homo - or heterodimer complex formation in vitro ( E.Hara , M.Hall , and G.Peters , EMBO J.16 : 332-342 , 1997 ) .

text: We now show that an analogous cell-cycle - regulated phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alters the specificity of <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> for abrogating both E-box - dependent bHLH homo - or heterodimer complex formation in vitro and E-box - dependent reporter gene function in vivo .

text: Furthermore , compared with wild-type <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , an <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Asp5 mutant ( mimicking phosphorylation ) is unable to promote cell cycle S phase entry in transfected fibroblasts , whereas an <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Ala5 mutant ( ablating phosphorylation ) displays an activity significantly greater than that of wild-type <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein .

<extra_id_0> Cdk2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent phosphorylation therefore provides a switch during late G1-to - S phase that both nullifies an early G1 cell cycle regulatory function of <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and modulates its target bHLH specificity .

These data also demonstrate that the ability of <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to promote cell cycle S phase entry is not simply a function of its ability to modulate bHLH heterodimer - dependent gene expression and establish a biologically important mechanism through which <extra_id_0> Cdk2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and Id-bHLH functions are integrated in the coordination of cell proliferation and differentiation .
